website_summaries.verdict: Convection cooking capabilities make this microwave a versatile choice with useful extra options.
pros: Features convection cooking mode to speed up cooking and also give you the unique ability to brown, bake, and broil in your microwave
Customers report that it works very well despite operating at only 850 watts
cons: In order for the convection mode to work well, the turntable must be allowed to rotate
This limits the size pan you can use

customer_reviews.title: New But Same
customer_reviews.text: I love this appliance. We are full-time RVers. We purchased our 2004 motorhome in 2013. I had never used a convection oven before, but quickly learned to like this combination oven. When it needed replacing a month ago, we researched other "RV- friendly" micro/convec combo ovens. It didn't take long to realize that we wanted the exact same type that had been original in the motorhome. It microwaves wonderfully and bakes beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Mary & Doug

customer_reviews.title: It's reliable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the same model Sharp microwave/convection oven I had for 12 years. I was elated to find that this model was still being produced. It's reliable and easy to use. We also had this same model in our RV, so the convection part was used a lot and works great for baking. I paid someone $100 to remove the non-working one and replace it with the same model. Hoping this new one lasts 12 years, also.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great unit
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing unit. This is my 4th one to on. It seems to be standard equipment in upper end motorhomes. I recently purchased another couch and wanted to upgrade to stainless steel look. This unit works better than my Samsung in my house. I paid twice as much for it. I don’t understood the other reviews that rate it lower. None of the units I have owned ever failed. I use a coach more than half a year for my business travel. All my cooking is done with it. Looking back at past 20 years of service the cost of ownership is 8 cents a day. I have zero complaints.

customer_reviews.title: Bought for RV & had to have one in home too!!

We’ve had other Sharp appliances and it’s products just lasts not like the brands who’s appliances are like buying disposable products that you have to replace every other year. The built-in exhaust system offers three convenient venting options - horizontal, vertical or ductless recirculation - to provide convenience for range-top cooking. The oven has an Interactive Cooking System with Custom Help key for easy-to-follow cooking and programming instructions. It is also equipped with a 4-way convection system that browns, bakes, broils and crisps.
